Sentece: The mean (+/- SD) peak concentrations of unbound prednisolone were higher after i.v. prednisolone phosphate (18.5 +/- 3.4 micrograms/ml) than after i.v. prednisolone phthalate (2.9 +/- 0.5 micrograms/ml) or after oral prednisone (3.1 +/- 0.8 micrograms/ml), (P less than 0.001).
Title: Pharmacokinetics of 3 prednisolone prodrugs. Evidence of therapeutic inequivalence in renal transplant patients with rejection.
Name: Prednisolone

Sentece: In study 2, the mean methylprednisolone clearance was 261 +/- 150 mL/min/kg (p > 0.05) and the mean volume of distribution was 0.89 +/- 0.31 L/kg (p > 0.05).
Title: Repeated assessment of methylprednisolone pharmacokinetics during chronic immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients.
Name: Prednisolone

Sentece: The mean serum half-life of methylprednisolone was 2.91 +/- 0.60 h (p > 0.05), with the mean elimination rate constant of 0.25 +/- 0.06 h-1 (p > 0.05).
Title: Repeated assessment of methylprednisolone pharmacokinetics during chronic immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients.
Name: Prednisolone

Sentece: The mean serum half-life of methylprednisolone was 2.91 +/- 0.60 h (p > 0.05), with the mean elimination rate constant of 0.25 +/- 0.06 h-1 (p > 0.05).
Title: Repeated assessment of methylprednisolone pharmacokinetics during chronic immunosuppression in renal transplant recipients.
Name: Prednisolone

Sentece: In transplant patients, the approved dose of 0.75-1 mg twice daily (BID) results in subtherapeutic trough levels (<6 μg l-1 ) and that a higher starting dose of 2.25-3 mg BID is required.
Title: A pharmacological rationale for improved everolimus dosing in oncology and transplant patients.
Name: Prednisolone
